page.title: 06Meldrum School, Oldmeldrum
page.content: Of a population of 2,225 for the combined parishes of Meldrum and Bourtie and the town of Oldmeldrum in 1985, the primary school provides education for 226 pupils ranging from age 4 (nursery) to age 11. There are also two playgroups for 60 children. Indications are that the community is taking care of the rise in population caused by the oil industry boom in Scotland's Northeast and the presssure put on by Grampian Regional Council to house oil-related workers and their families in Gordon District, within a 20 to 30-mile radius of Aberdeen. A regional plan has created dormitory suburb conditions in Oldmeldrum, but the children appear to take the cultural mix well. Children of Scots farming families make friends with those from incoming families, from German & French to Japanese & American
